page.title: 15DOLLIS BROOK
page.content: Dollis Brook is approximately 8 miles in length. It rises in Moat Mount Open Space and flows into the River Brent. It is a meandering brook and it is possible to walk along it through attractive park and play areas. There is a good example of an oxbow lake at Dollis Road. Dollis Brook has to pass under several large roads including the A1/A41 at Hendon Lane. A large 13 arch railway viaduct crosses over it between Finchley and Mill Hill. The brook meanders its way down from Barnet on the West side of the A1000, through Whetstone, North Finchley, and Finchley Central. It then veers West under the viaduct towards the A1 to join the River Brent which flows into the Brent Reservoir.
